Package com.frc5113.library.motors

Class SmartFalcon

java.lang.Object
com.ctre.phoenix.motorcontrol.can.BaseMotorController
com.ctre.phoenix.motorcontrol.can.BaseTalon
com.ctre.phoenix.motorcontrol.can.TalonFX
com.ctre.phoenix.motorcontrol.can.WPI_TalonFX
com.frc5113.library.motors.SmartFalcon
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.ctre.phoenix.motorcontrol.IFollower, com.ctre.phoenix.motorcontrol.IMotorController, com.ctre.phoenix.motorcontrol.IMotorControllerEnhanced, com.ctre.phoenix.signals.IInvertable, com.ctre.phoenix.signals.IOutputSignal, edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.Sendable, edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.motorcontrol.MotorController, AutoCloseable
public class SmartFalcon extends com.ctre.phoenix.motorcontrol.can.WPI_TalonFX
Modifications to TalonFX-esq motors (commonly the Talon)
  • Auto-wrenching default talon configs
  • Chainable configuration
  • Encoder improvements
  • Readability / usability improvements

  • Constructor Details

    • SmartFalcon

      public SmartFalcon(int canID)
      Create a new Smart TalonFX with Falcon based parameters. Not Inverted and Coasts on stop
      Parameters:
      canID - integer CAN network ID

    • SmartFalcon

      public SmartFalcon(int canID, boolean inverted)
      Create a new Smart TalonFX with Falcon based parameters Coasts on .set(0)
      Parameters:
      canID - integer CAN network ID
      inverted - spin backwards?

    • SmartFalcon

      public SmartFalcon(int canID, boolean inverted, com.ctre.phoenix.motorcontrol.NeutralMode neutralMode)
      Create a new Smart TalonFX with Falcon based parameters
      Parameters:
      canID - integer CAN network ID
      inverted - spin backwards?
      neutralMode - Whether to break or coast when .set(0);

    • SmartFalcon

      public SmartFalcon(int canID, boolean inverted, com.ctre.phoenix.motorcontrol.NeutralMode neutralMode, edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Translation2d position)

    • configurePID

      public SmartFalcon configurePID(double P, double I, double D)
      Chainable, configure parameters for a PID
      Parameters:
      P - Proportional Coefficient
      I - Integral Coefficient
      D - Derivative Coefficient
      Returns:
      configured falcon

      public SmartFalcon configurePID()

      Returns:

      Get the selected sensor velocity.
      Returns:
      selected sensor (in raw sensor units) per 100ms. See Phoenix-Documentation for how to interpret.

    • getEncoderVelocity

      public double getEncoderVelocity()
      Get the selected sensor velocity.
      Returns:
      selected sensor (in raw sensor units) per second. See Phoenix-Documentation for how to interpret.

      Parameters:
      input - Percent max voltage (between (inc.) -1 and 1)

    • configureOutput

      public SmartFalcon configureOutput(double diameter, double gearRatio)
      Configure the radius / gear ratio of the output of the motor (ie a wheel)
      Parameters:
      diameter - Radius of the output mechanism
      gearRatio - Gear ratio between the input and output (>1 means output is going slower than input, <1 means output is going faster than input)
      Returns:
      Configured motor

    • getOutputSpeed

      public double getOutputSpeed()
      Compute the travel speed (units per second) on the output

    • setCurrentLimit

      public SmartFalcon setCurrentLimit(double limit)

    • isConnected

      public boolean isConnected()
      Check if the falcon is connected (and alive).

      Runs two tests (motor safety timeout check - succeeds if motor safety is disabled) and checks that there is no last error.

      May be slow, so use sparingly

      Returns:
      connected and alive
